reviews.review_msg: I had a completely different experience.  Peloza was funny in class but rude when you want to talk to him.  Maybe he just has students he likes and students he doesn't like.
Best Marketing Class Ever! You'll be soo glad you took this course! Great prof, super relateable! You learn a ton but in a fun way...just make sure you participate, it will help your mark!
John is a very nice prof! very easy-going ! I would recommend ppl taking his course~!! I think if you done the reading, you wont do bad on the exams!!  Casual way of teaching Love it!
The other reviews are just too harsh zahra really is a good prof and truly cares about her students!

She's very unorganized and vague with her assignments. Gets mad at students for asking questions when she gives confusing instructions. I would avoid her if possible, learned absolutely nothing from this course.

Like other reviews have mentioned, Zahra is very unorganized. Her assignment instructions are very vague/not written down but she gets mad when students ask her questions to clarify. The curve is very high and the reflection is pretty much pointless. I'd avoid taking her classes if you can.

Worst marketing prof I have ever. She will randomly mute her zoom to talk to her kids mid sentence. Has not updated syllabus in years and gets annoyed when people ask questions about it. She also says I already said that and does not host office hours. No idea why she became a prof if she doesnt want to deal with questions. Groups are random gl

I think some of the past reviews were just too harsh! Zahra is somewhat disorganized, but her lectures were informative and she cares about her students. She's an easy marker, so you will have to perfect most of the assignments to beat the curve and get an A. She can be sassy at times, but she's an overall decent prof and a sweet person!

Worst SFU business prof. Majority of lecture time is spent on technical difficulties, being muted for personal matters, ranting to the class about personal matters, or making jokes/puns with her favorite students. A waste of time and money. Little instructions are given for projects. Student questions are not properly answered. Avoid if you can.
Linda is a great professor! Of course there is a lot of work for this course, but is definitely doable!

Linda is an excellent professor who uses her industry knowledge to create an insightful classroom experience. She is extremely dedicated, and is willing to go above and beyond to assist students both inside and outside the classroom. I found her class to be a rewarding experience, and I would highly recommend taking it to any student.
It is very hard to get good grades in Linda's class.

Linda has a very poor attitude towards students which demotivates rather than motivates. She administers very low grades with little justification and provides unclear guidelines. This lecturer is passive aggressive, I would not recommend her.
